result.execSummary:
The defendant Nurazam Bin Ibrahim was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges. Provide DNA Sample.

Batterers Intervention program, can be completed through approved individual therapy.
Parenting classes.
Absolute sobriety.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

timeConds.notes: STAYED pending review held 11/20/2015 at 1:30 PM.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nurazam Bin Ibrahim

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nurazam Bin Ibrahim in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Sworn in as interpreter, Simon Koko.
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. Received & Filed, Letter on behalf of defendant.
AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED
The court WITHHELD the Sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 30 DAYS as Condition Time, STAYED pending review held 11/20/2015 at 1:30 PM.
-Batterers Intervention program, can be completed through approved individual therapy.
-Parenting classes.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No VIOLENT contact with victim.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised defendant of penalties for violation of NO CONTACT ORDER.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

AS TO COUNT 1 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Nurazam Bin Ibrahim in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Simon Koko.  Case set for Plea & Sentencing.
AS TO COUNT 1
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, Domestic Abuse, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 947.01(1), 968.075(1)(a), a Class B Misdemeanor.

Victim present in courtroom gallery. Through the ADA and Victim/Witness Advocation by use of interpreter victim is requesting modification of the No Contact orders.  State opposes.  Court allows telephone and electronic contact ONLY. Defendant and victim may not discuss this case.

Defendant Nurazam Bin Ibrahim in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Simon Koko. Attorney Thomey appointed by Jan Maike via telephone from SPD office. Interpreter, through use of microphone-headset, is interpreting the court for both the defendant and the victim. Defense counsel requested case be set for a Plea & Sentencing date. Case adjourend to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM023260  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/05/2015
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 05-19-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Nurazam Bin Ibrahim
Current: 4819 South 13th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53221   (Effective: 05-06-2015)
Prior: 4819 South 13th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53221
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Zaitun H. or the residence or place of employment

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br.23.vb

Defendant Nurazam Bin Ibrahim in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Sworn as interpreter: Simon KoKo
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 5/6/15 @ 1:30pm
